questions.answer_description: This program takes a user-supplied string and copies it into 'buffer1', which can hold up to 10 bytes of data. If a user sends more than 10 bytes, it would result in a buffer overflow.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
John's program is vulnerable to a Buffer overflow attack.
Correct answer: C. Buffer overflow

questions.answer_description:
The hop limit field in the IPv6 header is decremented by 1 for each router that forwards a packet. The packet is discarded when the hop limit field reaches zero.
Answer option B is incorrect. Next header is an 8-bit field that specifies the next encapsulated protocol.
Answer option A is incorrect. Flow label is a 20-bit field that is used for specifying special router handling from source to destination for a sequence of packets.
Answer option C is incorrect. Traffic class is an 8-bit field that specifies the Internet traffic priority delivery value.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
I can't really find in CND Book a page where literally says that Hop-Limit decerase by 1 at each router jump, but says that replaces IPv4 TTL, and in P.2559 says:

Time to live (TTL): This field defines the lifetime of the IP datagram in the Internet system. The TTL field is initially set to a number and decremented by every router. When the TTL reaches zero, it discards the datagram (packet).

So i think that ensure option D

questions.question_text: Which of the following fields in the IPv6 header is decremented by 1 for each router that forwards the packet?

You have just set up a wireless network for customers at a coffee shop. Which of the following are good security measures to implement? Each correct answer represents a complete solution. (Choose two.)
questions.answer_description: With either encryption method (WEP or WPA), you can give the password to the customers who need it, and even change it frequently (daily if you like). So this won't be an inconvenience for the customers.

discussion.content: Yep, WEP encryption is a terrible security measure to implement! Guessing this was a very old question.
Answer might AB.Because wep is not safe anymore.

Selected Answer: ABCD
All of the above

choices.B: It provides mobility to users to access a network.
choices.A: Data can be shared easily between wireless devices.
choices.C: Data can be transmitted in different ways by using Cellular Networks, Mobitex, DataTAC, etc.

questions.question_text:
Which of the following statements are true about a wireless network?
Each correct answer represents a complete solution. Choose all that apply.

questions.answer_description:
Encrypting confidential data stored on the server and performing regular backup will not make the server fault tolerant.
Fault tolerance is the ability to continue work when a hardware failure occurs on a system. A fault-tolerant system is designed from the ground up for reliability by building multiples of all critical components, such as CPUs, memories, disks and power supplies into the same computer. In the event one component fails, another takes over without skipping a beat.
Answer options A, C, and D are incorrect. The following steps will make the server fault tolerant:
Adding a second power supply unit
Adding one more same sized disk as a mirror on the server implementing cluster servers facility

choices.E: Encrypting confidential data stored on the server
choices.B: Performing regular backup of the server
choices.C: Adding one more same sized disk as mirror on the server
choices.A: Adding a second power supply unit

questions.question_text: Which of the following steps will NOT make a server fault tolerant? Each correct answer represents a complete solution. (Choose two.)

discussion.content: C feels a bit wrong, if the server is down the mirror party on the same server also does not work.
